pros: - learned so much - gained my confidence - amazing team - range of activities - saw a change in what we were doing
cons: - mentally exhausting at times - very tiring

review_title: good work culture but should have more training
pros: really rewarding work, and nice workplace culture. you get to meet lots of varied people
cons: there could be more training and support from seniors

pros:
- Great team who really care about they do
- Amazing children and young people
- Every day is different
- The organisation does some really important work
- Mostly a very inclusive organisation. Diversity embraced and celebrated at all levels
- Great training opportunities

Probably one of the most important jobs I've ever had and one I will remember fondly. It changed my entire life and career goals. I met some of the most amazing children and young people, and learned so much.
cons:
- Very physically demanding job. Always on your feet. 
- Some very challenging situations (challenging behaviour, support very anxious individuals)
- Can be very stressful
- Sometimes the term 'inclusivity' is misunderstood. Inclusivity doesn't mean everyone doing the same thing in the same place.
- Paid very little for doing a lot (but this is the same in most social care/SEN/charity roles, so not unique to this organisation)

review_title: Really nice but not for me
pros: I had a wonderful time. Everyone I met was so helpful and encouraging just a bunch of wonderful people and a warm environment in general, and they gave excellent training.
cons:
the job itself is very tiring but I guess that's expected and they do understand that.
Had to travel quite far for training.

job_title: Youth Worker in Farnham, South East England, England
pros: I loved working for challengers! Great place to work rewarding, challenging, hardworking and playful, you learn alot as a youth worker!
cons: I don't even have a downside to this job! The only downside is that I wish they had more funding to acsess more outdoor activities!

job_title: Play Worker in Alton, South East England, England
pros:
• good teamwork 
• valuable experience and skills learnt
cons:
• long hours 
• poor pay for such a demanding job

pros:
- great staff
great young people 
educational
cons: hard work and tiring, also can be stressful

review_title: 1-1 days with allocated child, file provided on their individual needs, likes and dislikes.
job_title: Child Play Worker in Guildford, England
pros: a fun and worthwhile job
cons: at time challenging as the name suggests, need to be able to remain calm in stressful situations.

job_title: Youth and Play Worker in Basingstoke, England
pros: I had lots of fun working there
cons: I have no concerns with regards to cons

job_title: Community Fundraising Officer in London, England
pros:
I started working at Challengers when I was 16 as a playworker and now I'm 25 and have moved into the fundraising team. Challengers really makes my job as a fundraiser so easy as its just such a wonderful place, full of support and smiles. 

I couldn't think of a better Saturday job to have at 16 than getting ot play all day and really make a positive impact in these children's and their families lives. You get to work with such great people from the leaders to your team to the children. my work as a playworker shaped what I want to do with my life and so Challengers will always have a very large place in my heart.
cons: There really aren't any, even if you might have a bad day you know you did some good somewhere.

pros: Great company to work for with great people, flexible on hours, really rewarding work in a great environment. It is really easy to see the difference you are making to these young people's lives. Also offer excellent training which really helps if you are looking at working full time in a care environment.
cons: Not always hours available in a local area so sometimes travel is required if you wish to work more than originally planned. Also, travel is required for training.

job_title: Youth Worker in Farnham, South East England, England
pros: Opportunity to contribute positively to the lives of fantastic young people. Character building and fun at times.
cons: Expect their most trusted and reliable staff to do a lot for nothing. The work is rewarding in itself but the company makes it difficult for people to stay long-term.

pros:
Brilliant team leaders and all other staff members are lovely.
Days always go by quickly!
Always able to get work in the holidays.
Work days are always different.
Support for yourselves is always there.
cons: Exhausting work, you need to be very mentally capable to deal with constantly being 10% alert. Can ever switch off in the day, even on lunch breaks.

job_title: Youth and Play Worker in Farnham, South East England, England
pros: Challengers is an amazing place to work. Can't really pick out one reason but here are a few;  fantastic staff training, friendly happy place to be in, great team, and most importantly the families and children we provide for. Without challengers some families wouldn't be a family today and some may not even have their children living with them.
cons: Non whatsover, best place to work in and very rewarding, not just for the staff but for the families as well

review_title: Really rewarding job, really amazing people!
pros: The people that at Challengers are so dedicated and committed to the cause. I am fortunate enough to work with some very inspiring and passionate individuals.  Flexible working patterns make my life with a toddler so my easier
cons: I think the pay should reflect the individuals quality of work more than it does.

pros: Great working environment, amazing team ethic! Great support and advice offered all the time! Everyone has the same mission in mind and all help each other to achieve it!
cons: I can't actually think of any!?

review_title: Good part-time/first time job for young people
pros: Good experience for people who want to work in care setting. Enjoyable for people who want to work with children.
cons: Very low pay and poor occasionally poor organisation.

review_title: Never knew how much I'd miss it

pros: Wonderful company to work for, they offer brilliant training opportunities and truly care about their staff

pros: Challengers is inspiring, motivating, rewarding and fun! An amazing place to work.
